<small>Hebrew form: [[H5782]]</small>
 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עִיר‎</span> **noun masculine** ==waking, or wakeful, one==, i.e. ==angel== (√<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עיר‎</span>, compare Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***wake***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***waking*** ([[BDB#PS|PS]]<sup>2843</sup>), Jewish-Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עִיר‎</span>, Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֵיר‎</span> adjective ***awake***); — absolute <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ע‎</span> [[Dan.4.10|Dan 4:10]]; [[Dan.4.20|Dan 4:20]] plural absolute <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עִירִין‎</span> v.[[Dan.4.14|Dan 4:14]] [[BDB#Aq|Aq]] [[BDB#Symm|Symm]]. <span class="bdbLangGreek">ἐγρήγορος</span>; compare Charles<sup>Enoch i. 5</sup>; xxxix. 12; also p. 356 [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>on the passage</sup>; doubtful is the connection with Phoenician ***Zophesemim*** ([[BDB#Euseb|Euseb]]<sup>Praep. Evang. 10</sup>), i.e. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎צפי שמים‎</span> ***watchers of heaven***, as ***keeping watch over*** or ***spying out*** ([[BDB#Zim|Zim]]<sup>KAT 3. 629</sup> [[BDB#Jerem|Jerem]]<sup>Atim Licht d. AO 63</sup>). <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עַל‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עֵלָּא‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עלה‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עִלָּה‎</span> see I.  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עלל‎</span>.
